com.mousebird.maply

Class LabelInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.BaseInfo
      • com.mousebird.maply.LabelInfo

  • public class LabelInfo
extends BaseInfo
    We use this class to designate attribute shared by a group of labels. Rather than specifying them individually they all go here. You would use this class in the course of an addLabels() or addScreenLabels() call on the MaplyController.

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(float r,
                               float g,
                               float b,
                               float a)
        Set the background color of text. This is what appears in the rectangles behind the text. Color components range from 0.0 to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        r - red
        g - green
        b - blue
        a - alpha

      • setLayoutImportance

        public void setLayoutImportance(float importance)
        The layout engine controls how text is displayed. It tries to avoid overlaps and takes priority into account. The layout importance controls which labels (or other features) are laid out first. Bigger is more important.

        Defaults to MAXFLOAT, which is off. That means the layout engine does not control the associated labels.

      • setLayoutPlacement

        public void setLayoutPlacement(int newPlacement)
        The layout placement controls where we can put the label relative to its point.

      • setTextJustify

        public void setTextJustify(LabelInfo.TextJustify textJustify)
        For multi-line labels, you can justify the text to the left, right or center. Only works for multi-line labels.

      • getTypeface

        public android.graphics.Typeface getTypeface()
        Return the typeface used for the labels.
